intro: Carpodinus alnifolia, commonly known as the alderleaf maple, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its opposite, simple, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by winged fruits called samaras. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age. The plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in riparian zones.
